messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a quick note
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Craig, yes it is an interesting beast, I like it a lot LOL. I was just looking at the photo s from that dinner this morning. It was a good evening. Rich
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Craig, yes it is an interesting beast, I like it a lot LOL. I was
just looking at the photo's from that dinner this morning. It was a good
evening.

Rich

messages.msgSnippet: Congrats, Rich! I m really glad I got to see the Sadahiro in person, good to see the pictures again. I m still quite taken by the larger piercing below the
messages.messageBody:
Congrats, Rich! I'm really glad I got to see the Sadahiro in person, good to
see the pictures again. I'm still quite taken by the larger piercing below
the nakago-ana especially.

Craig

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a quick note
messages.msgSnippet: oh well, not meant for the general public but hey, what the heck. The Sadahiro link was/is attached. I am assuming a  Den Sadahiro attribution. The Soyo were a
messages.messageBody:
oh well, not meant for the general public but hey, what the heck. The
Sadahiro link was/is attached. I am assuming a Den Sadahiro
attribution. The Soyo were a Fuchi Kashira on a tsuka. Shinsa was at the
NTHK in Japan.

Cheers

Rich



Richard Turner wrote:
>
> The Sadahiro passed shinsa which is great. The Soyo bounced, sort of
> expected, a big name also so 1 out of 2 big names is a good result.

messages.subject: a quick note
messages.msgSnippet: The Sadahiro passed shinsa which is great. The Soyo bounced, sort of expected, a big name also so 1 out of 2 big names is a good result.
messages.messageBody:
The Sadahiro passed shinsa which is great. The Soyo bounced, sort of
expected, a big name also so 1 out of 2 big names is a good result.

http://www.nihontokanjipages.com/personal/tsuba_collection/owari_sadahiro.html

Tricks

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a little more direction - AN ANSWER??
messages.msgSnippet: G day All, ... Unless I m going blind from too much hooch, Nelson doesn t show any character for YOSHI that remotely resembles the one on Elliot s tsuba.  I
messages.messageBody:
G'day All,

Elliot wrote:
> Photo's #5 and #6 are the best close-up's of the Myochin mei
> I can get with my lack of good photo equipment. Hopefully
> these will help in deciding which one (Muneharu or Muneyoshi).

Unless I'm going blind from too much hooch, Nelson doesn't show any character for YOSHI that remotely resembles the one on Elliot's tsuba. I would say with 100% certainty that the mei reads MUNEHARU.

Best regards,

Barry Thomas.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
